title.narrative: Training for attorneys working on capital cases in Nigeria

description.narrative: In 2017, The Cornell Center on the Death Penalty Worldwide welcomed applications for its first Makwanyane Institute, an intensive training workshop for capital defenders from June 12 to 20, 2017. Named in honor of the South African Constitutional Court’s seminal decision abolishing the death penalty, the Institute offered fifteen Fellows the opportunity to participate in specialized training, litigation support, and community-building. In its first year, the Institute trained criminal defense lawyers practicing in common law jurisdictions in Africa. ASF France representatives (Angela Uwandu and Abiodun Odusote, Lagos support lawyer) having participated in this training are now desirous of conducting a step down training for the network of ASF France lawyers handling death penalty cases as well as other attorneys committed to representing persons facing the death penalty. This will be a unique opportunity to share the knowledge acquired at the specialised training and to foster relationship with the network. It’s also an opportunity for ASF France to hold an event to mark the world day against the death penalty.
